meanings.sent1: She always mistiming her jokes, making them less funny.
meanings.sent2: He mistiming his jump and fell into the pool.
meanings.sent3: The magician mistiming his disappearing act, leaving the audience puzzled.
meanings.sent4: The chef mistiming the baking of the cake, resulting in a burnt dessert.
meanings.sent5: The student mistiming the exam, causing unnecessary stress.

meanings.definition: The act of timing something incorrectly.
meanings.sent1: The mistiming of the fireworks display disappointed the crowd.
meanings.sent2: Her mistiming of the dance routine threw off the entire performance.
meanings.sent3: The mistiming of the punchline made the joke fall flat.
meanings.sent4: The mistiming of the traffic lights caused a long delay.
meanings.sent5: The mistiming of the music cue disrupted the flow of the play.
